newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Turnbull joins Goldman Sachs Australia and N.Z..
newsitem.headline: Turnbull joins Goldman Sachs Australia and N.Z..

text.p: Malcolm Turnbull, founder of investment bank Turnbull & Partners, will join Goldman Sachs Australia and New Zealand as chairman and managing director on August 1, Goldman Sachs said on Tuesday.
He would be based in Sydney and would oversee Goldman Sachs' businesses in the region.
In joining Goldman Sachs, Turnbull would close Turnbull & Partners and Turnbull's partner, the former premier of New South Wales, Neville Wran, would become a senior adviser to Goldman Sachs.

Commenting on the announcement, Jon S. Corzine, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Goldman Sachs Group L.P. said: "Malcolm Turnbull is one of Australia's leading merchant bankers and brings outstanding experience to the firm."
"His appointment underlines Goldman Sachs' commitment to building a pre-eminent investment banking franchise in Australia and New Zealand and throughout the Asian region," Corzine said.
Turnbull founded Turnbull & Partners in 1987, an investment banking boutique specialising in the merger and principal investment business.
He is also chairman of OzEmail Ltd, a NASDAQ-LISTED Australian Internet service provider, and FTR Holdings Ltd, a software development company.

"I am delighted to be joining the world's leading investment bank and have every confidence that, working with the Goldman Sachs team in Australia and around the world, we will be able to build a substantial business in Australasia," Turnbull said.
Cass O'Connor, a specialist in media and telecommunications, would also join Goldman Sachs as a Vice President in the Investment Banking Division.
